result.execSummary:
The defendant Russell Duane Pointer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine/Methamphetamine/etc.(>3-10g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is eligible for CIP and SAP but only after serving 18 months of Initial Confinement.  Cred for 0 days for time served - Attorneys to figure out credit and if time should be awarded they will send stipulation to the Court and JOC will be amended.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay DNA surcharge - to be payable out of prison monies

Not allowed to vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.  No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.   No contact with known drug users or sellers except in a treatment setting and only with prior agent approval.
Provide DNA sample by 9-20-2022.  Assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent.  Maintain/obtain full time employment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Russell Duane Pointer

Eligible for CIP and SAP but only after serving 18 Months of Initial Confinement

Constitutional rights.
Read-ins.
Victim rights compliance. 
Deft understands.
Atty satisfied.
Factual basis.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea and finds Deft guilty on Count 1, without repeater and without possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Jail enhancer. 
Court dismisses and reads-in Counts 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 and 7. 
Court order presentence investigation be completed.  Agent to provide report to court at least 14 days prior to sentencing.  
Court removes JT from calendar. 
Court schedules with parties.
